entry.title: Non-ssl redirect bug when service worker handles a request
entry.content: # Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create an HTML document that includes: - An tag with a src attribute pointing to a URL that will be redirected, and service worker registration. - JavaScript code to register a Service Worker. 2. Create a service-worker.js file: Write a simple Service Worker script that listens for fetch events and handles them by calling `fetch(event.request)` (with the default redirect `follow` mode) to make network requests for the incoming fetch events. 3. Prepare a image resource that redirects to http location from https. I implemented a simple node module that redirects to the image resource but with an HTTP URL instead of HTTPS. This module is responsible for issuing an HTTP redirect response (e.g., with a 301 or 302 status code) to the client. You can test it either in the demo page I created (https://bold-wave-65.app.baqend.com/v1/file/www/nonSslRedirectTest/index.html) or by implementing something similar. 4. Access the HTML page via HTTPS: Open a web browser and navigate to the HTTPS version of the HTML page on your server. This action should trigger the registration of the Service Worker. 5. Observe the behavior: If service worker is active, the img asset request leads to a mixed content error. If service worker is not active (e.g. Bypass for network is on), the request seems to be automatically upgraded to https and does not lead to a mixxd content error. # Problem Description When an HTTPS asset requests that returns an HTTP redirect, Chrome automatically rewrites the URL to HTTPS to prevent errors as this can be observed when service worker is not activated in the demo app. However, when a service worker is active and intercepts the image fetch request with redirect mode follow, the HTTP variant is requested, which then results in a mixed-content error. # Additional Comments Attached files are the html file and sw.js file that I used for my demo app. # Summary Non-ssl redirect bug when service worker handles a request # Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>ServiceWorker #### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know # Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.content: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appintents

entry.title: Change the way CF's Job configuration works
entry.content:
As for now, Job configuration happens at: https://clusterfuzz.com/jobs. This works great, but it is hard to keep track of what is actually being taken into account in the configuration.
Moreover, this would allow more control over configuration change, which caused: crbug.com/326023008.
For example, we could have JSON configuration files, such as: ```json { "app_name": "chrome", "asan_options": "allow_user_segv_handler=1" } ```
This file would be located in the ClusterFuzz repository. Since the repository is public, anyone could make a PR to change the configuration, but this would be versioned, and controlled.

entry.title: Add timeout for FencedFrameReporter request.
entry.content:
FencedFrameReporter's network requests don't have a timeout. They are headless requests (not associated with a render frame or killed when a frame goes away), so not user-cancellable. There is a global limit on number of simultaneous connections, and if a request stalls, seems not great to perpetually eat quota. FLEDGE uses 30 second timeouts everywhere, which may or may not be reasonable.
We should consider adding a timeout for fenced frame.

entry.title: Skip the view transition if document is hidden at beginning/during
entry.content: As per spec, we should now do the following: - skip the transition immediately if the document is hidden - skip the transition when the document becomes hidden - never start a cross-doc vt on a hidden document.

entry.title: Optimize startup time and application hang time with grey snapshots
entry.content:
Grey snapshots were removed as a part of refactoring snapshot system ([issue/40279302](https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/40279302), [experiment document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-zbYietyOIS0DrYsbQsrTZm4gO5249n48za6HSzmMZw/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-EuGzuuc6-I9Y5dZbV0YnLQ)). It improved memory usage and disk usage but `IOS.MetricKit.ApplicationHangTime` and `IOS.MetricKit.ExtendedLaunch` regressed because grey snapshots are used as a placeholder of each tab until loading the content is finished and they are generated in-flight after the refactoring work.
All grey snapshots are not necessary to be generated. We can generate grey snapshots based on its visibility.

entry.title: CDP Log domain does not emit events for entries other than error
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a webdriver instance with DevTools session. 2. Enable Log domain by invoking the Log.Enable function; https://chromedevtools.github.io/devtools-protocol/tot/Log/#method-enable 3. Make sure to subscribe to the Log.EntryAdded events; https://chromedevtools.github.io/devtools-protocol/tot/Log/#event-entryAdded 3. Navigate to a webpage which outputs entries to the console. 4. Only events which are of type error are emitted as events.
# Problem Description When subscribing to the Log.EntryAdded I expect all entries in the console log to be emitted as events. There is no option to enable this.
Using the Console domain there is a Console.messageAdded event, however the Console domain is deprecated and lacks some of the properties which are available on the Log domain.
# Summary CDP Log domain does not emit events for entries other than error
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: share> add/edit bookmark is broken in half of the entry points
entry.content:
This bug can be obtained in many different way and have the same result
# How to reproduce: * open history, reading list or bookmarks list * long tap an entry * tap share * either ** you get "add bookmark" option, in this case: *** tap "add bookmark" *** tap "edit" in the snackbar ** or you get "edit bookmark", in this case: *** Tap "edit bookmark"
Expected behavior: * open the editor * maybe close the current reading list/history first ?
Actual behavior: * log: > Attempt to present <TableViewNavigationController: 0x13c04672e00> on <TabGridViewController: 0x13c003b1600> (from <TabGridViewController: 0x13c003b1600>) which is already presenting <TableViewNavigationController: 0x13c00394800>.
Next bookmark interaction will crash in canary/dev.
The reasons is that the tab grid view controller is already presenting either history, reading list or bookmark list. And it can’t present anything else on top of it. Actually, it’s not even clear we want to present the bookmark editor on top of the reading list or on top of the history. Maybe they should be close first. That needs to be decided by a PM.
Both cases seems to require complex code change.

entry.title: Extend omnibox API to render a little image in the address bar's drop-down list
entry.content:
This is a feature request. It would be possible to extend the omnibox API to handle a little icon\image like the ones we see when start typing the name of a state or famous person in the address bar?
The "suggest" function of **chrome.omnibox.onInputChanged** event handler (function that the event listener call to supply suggestions for the address bar's drop-down list) receive an array of **omnibox.SuggestResult** objects, one for each suggestion.
The **omnibox.SuggestResult** object should now accept a new property for the image. The photo image could be a base64 URL and that property could be named "iconImg", "b64Img", "imgUrl" or similar.
My idea is to build an extention with an omnibox feature which generates a filtered list of contacts from my address book (or others sources) with a small photo alongside. Anyway there could be many other application.

entry.title: Incorrect width of an element in a grid layout
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. See attached html file
# Problem Description Chrome doesn't resolve width correctly for the element in a grid layout like this: >outer element (with fixed height, dispaly grid) > middle element > inner element (with aspect-ratio: 1 and height 100%)
In the attached example, the outer element's height is 40px, so the inner element is 40px by 40px, but the middle is 0px by 40px, when it should be 40x40 as well.
# Summary Incorrect width of an element in a grid layout
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>CSS
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Set-Cookie header is stripped from Response Headers on WebSocket upgrade request
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open DevTools 2. Make a WebSocket connection request to a URL which also adds a Set-Cookie header to the response 3. Observe that if it succeeds (101 Switching Protocols is returned), the Set-Cookie header is stripped from the Response Headers
# Problem Description After following the steps listed above, the Set-Cookie header does not appear in the list of Response Headers, however the cookie will still be applied correctly. Note that the Cookies tab in DevTools also doesn't appear indicating that a cookie has been set.
# Summary Set-Cookie header is stripped from Response Headers on WebSocket upgrade request
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Selected pixel format in vt_video_decode_accelerator_mac.cc is always video-range.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem As for discussion in https://issues.chromium.org/issues/41491921
# Problem Description I have an application that needs to display a full-range h.264 stream.
I decode using webcodecs (hardware acceleration) and paint using webgl2. The videoframe is automatically converted by WebGL into a rgb texture.
When feeding the decoder with a full-range h.264 stream, the rendered decoded frame have incorrect colors. That does not happen on Windows, and also disabling the MacOS hardware decoder the colors are correct.
My question is: * Should the pixel_format be kCVPixelFormatType_420YpCbCr8BiPlanarFullRange when the h.264 stream sps contains full range flag? * If not, in the related issue it is claimed:
> This works automatically on macOS since we always configure limited range on the VideoToolbox session and it internally detects the full range video and converts it to limited range:
At that point, is WebGL aware that the frame is not full range anymore so a yuv to rgb path conversion should take into account this?
Thanks, Fabio.
# Summary Selected pixel format in vt_video_decode_accelerator_mac.cc is always video-range.
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers?
Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Audio / Video \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Use a highDPI monitor under Gnome 44 with the Scale factor set to 200% in the Gnome settings (2) Make sure Chrome is running on Wayland (see chrome://flags/#ozone-platform-hint, don't use the Relaunch button after changing the backend, manually close and start the browser again) (3) Browse to https://whatismyviewport.com/
What is the expected result? The displayed DPR value should be 2.00 (meaning window.devicePixelRatio=2)
What happens instead? The displayed DPR value is 1.00

entry.title: UAF in FedCmAccountSelectionView::Show
entry.content:
VULNERABILITY DETAILS In function `FedCmAccountSelectionView::Show` if IDP sign-in modal dialog is open, the showing of the accounts dialog would be delayed [1], and once the modal dialog is closed, `show_accounts_dialog_callback_` would be executed to show the accounts dialog [2]. However in this path the code does not check FedCM API settings and if the embargo was triggered, the execution of `show_accounts_dialog_callback_` would destroy the FedCmAccountSelectionView and UAF occurs. Considering the following scenario: 1. website triggers a IDP failure 2. user clicks continue button to sign in, which opens the login page (modal dialog), and the login page triggers a new FedCM UI 3. user dismisses the UI in the login page which triggers embargo 4. The login page can be closed by JS code, and since the modal dialog is closed, `FedCmAccountSelectionView::Show` is called again to show the accounts dialog 5. Since FedCM is embargoed, it goes with `ShowVerifyingSheet -> OnAccountSelected -> CompleteRequestWithError`, which destory the FedCmAccountSelectionView 6. The code will continue access member of FedCmAccountSelectionView which leads to UAF
```c++ void FedCmAccountSelectionView::Show( const std::string& top_frame_etld_plus_one, const std::optional<std::string>& iframe_etld_plus_one, const std::vector<content::IdentityProviderData>& identity_provider_data_list, Account::SignInMode sign_in_mode, blink::mojom::RpMode rp_mode, bool show_auto_reauthn_checkbox) { if (popup_window_ && (state_ == State::IDP_SIGNIN_STATUS_MISMATCH || state_ == State::ACCOUNT_PICKER)) { popup_window_state_ = PopupWindowResult::kAccountsReceivedAndPopupNotClosedByIdp; show_accounts_dialog_callback_ = // ==> [1] base::BindOnce(&FedCmAccountSelectionView::Show, weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr(), top_frame_etld_plus_one, iframe_etld_plus_one, identity_provider_data_list, sign_in_mode, rp_mode, show_auto_reauthn_checkbox); return; }
void FedCmAccountSelectionView::CloseModalDialog() { // ... if (show_accounts_dialog_callback_) { std::move(show_accounts_dialog_callback_).Run(); // ==> [2] if (is_web_contents_visible_) { input_protector_->VisibilityChanged(true); GetDialogWidget()->Show(); } ``` [1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/webid/fedcm_account_selection_view_desktop.cc;l=82;drc=51747de656cd4c61e038b7d82e9b7bf20e6d2bb9 [2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/webid/fedcm_account_selection_view_desktop.cc;l=615;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090
VERSION Chrome Version: stable 121.0.6167.185 + dev
REPRODUCTION CASE Tested on: Chrome 123.0.6307.1 asan build 64-bit on Windows 10 1. Create a web server using node.js node ./server.js 2. Launch chrome and navigate to http://localhost:8000/poc.html out\Asan\chrome.exe http://localhost:8000/poc.html 3. Click continue button, then dismiss the dialog in the new popup page
Please be noted to create a new web server for each test, and clear browser user data is highly recommended.
FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Type of crash: browser Crash State: see asan.log for details
== Bisection == This was initially introduced in https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f4863c5e182188465f2511083ee130fd9d4fda15
== Additional Information == compromised renderer requirement: no miracle ptr protected: no user interaction: yes

is _possibly_ caused by the use of the `fork` strategy. My evidence is circumstantial, which is that this seems to affect some fuzzing tasks fatally and immediately, and others not at all. That pattern is hard to explain, and last time I saw such a pattern, it seemed to be related to use of the `fork` strategy.

entry.title: in_process_fuzzers rarely recording new features
entry.content:
The [fuzzing stats for `js_in_process_fuzzer`](https://clusterfuzz.com/fuzzer-stats?group_by=by-day&date_start=2024-02-13&date_end=2024-02-19&fuzzer=libFuzzer_js_in_process_fuzzer) show it succesfully explored 99000+ new features on one of the past 7 days, but 0 features on all the other days.
Assigning to myself to poke at the logs to work out why, though I won't get to it soon.

entry.title: centipede stats in ClusterFuzz are partial
entry.content:
The [stats for libfuzzer fuzzers](https://clusterfuzz.com/fuzzer-stats?group_by=by-day&date_start=2024-02-13&date_end=2024-02-19&fuzzer=libFuzzer_js_in_process_fuzzer) are much better than for [centipede fuzzers](https://clusterfuzz.com/fuzzer-stats?group_by=by-day&date_start=2024-02-13&date_end=2024-02-19&fuzzer=centipede_js_in_process_fuzzer).
Given that the libFuzzer team keeps telling us it's deprecated and that we should only be using centipede, we will need to fix this at some point.
I don't know if this is just affecting the display or also affecting fuzzing choices.

entry.title: "GPU failure" heuristic too aggressive
entry.content:
Looking at the [crashes from js_in_process_fuzzer over the past 7 days](https://clusterfuzz.com/crash-stats?block=day&days=7&end=474546&fuzzer=libFuzzer_js_in_process_fuzzer&group=platform&number=count&sort=total_count), we see:
* A `CHECK` failure in a timeout * A `GPU failure` in a timeout * A `GPU failure` related to `FieldTrialList` ([this bug](https://issues.chromium.org/issues/324301746))
Those bugs all individually need addressing, but we should _also_ handle the fact that many of these are misclassified as "GPU failures".
My understanding is that ClusterFuzz's heuristics will claim a bug is a GPU failure if its log includes a phrase along the lines of "GPU process exited unexpectedly". Unfortunately that's often a side effect of crashes elsewhere, e.g. in this case, in the browser process.
[Here's the code](https://github.com/google/clusterfuzz/blob/6f9b8429d05eb0ef8b9d272c2f54f9af600948ce/src/clusterfuzz/stacktraces/__init__.py#L884).
If we can think of a way to weaken that rule, we should.

entry.title: As part of default-enabling the IWA feature flag, update content::IsolatedWebAppsPolicy::AreIsolatedWebAppsEnabled() to solely rely on the feature flag and not also rely on the presence of the policy
entry.content: Until now, we enable IWAs when either the feature flag or the policy is present. After launch, we should rely solely on the feature flag.
